sentences.english: Steve uncorked bottles of champagne to toast the achievement.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫打開幾瓶香檳酒慶功。

sentences.english: In the end, there was plenty for the Chelsea boss to celebrate.
sentences.chinese: 在比賽結束後，切爾西的老闆仍然舉行了慶功會。

sentences.english: No matter how small, I will celebrate my successes today.
sentences.chinese: 不管多麼小，我都會爲我今天的成功慶功。

sentences.english: At the award ceremony after the celebration party on.
sentences.chinese: 在頒獎禮後的慶功宴上。

sentences.english: Now that it's finished, I think we should have a party.
sentences.chinese: 現在結束了，我想我們應該辦個慶功宴。

sentences.english: The ceremony was the 2008 Olympic Games wine "drunkard" and so on in this archive.
sentences.chinese: 2008年奧運會慶功酒“酒鬼”等就封存於此。

sentences.english: The people of the city laid on a victory banquet in honour of the world champion.
sentences.chinese: 該市人民爲世界冠軍舉行慶功宴。

sentences.english: Will the candidate deny the winner a triumphant election-night celebration?
sentences.chinese: 候選人是否會讓得勝者無法享受選舉夜的慶功歡樂？

sentences.english: So our leaders hold a celebratory dinner this evening.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我們的領導今天晚上舉行了一場慶功晚宴。

sentences.english: The celebration party will be held on an day to celebrate the of their efforts.
sentences.chinese: 慶功宴會選在吉日舉行，以慶祝他們努力的成果。

sentences.english: After one too many during official celebrations he kept drinking throughout the night.
sentences.chinese: 出席完官方的慶功宴後他還繼續喝，喝了一整晚。

sentences.english: This is a bunch of us at the celebration dinner after the concert.
sentences.chinese: 這是我們演唱會之後慶功宴在一起的照片。

definition: to add to the fun/to liven things up
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
two simultaneous happy events in the family
to have a few drinks/to drink to one's heart's content
to beat the gong to open a performance
to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
